intro: Canthium blepharodon, commonly known as the narrowleaf spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native range.
